title: World rankings of Men 's World Handball Championships 1938 to 2013
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting World Champion, 2nd, and 3rd. The y axis indicates the World Ranking and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall 3rd is rapidly increasing, World Champion is gradually increasing, 2nd is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of World Ranking in descending order is: 1. 3rd, 2. 2nd, and lastly, 3. World Champion.
Throughout the period, 3rd generally had the highest World Ranking relative to others with an average of 1.77, and it reached its maximum at Sweden, and Yugoslavia with a value of 4.0.
Followed by 2nd which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 1.8 World Ranking,reaching its highest point  at Germany/GDR with a value of 4.0.
The botommost line, World Champion,  has a mean of 1.77, and peaked at France, Romania, and Sweden.
